message:
Hi Geeks,
I have a small question and your answers very important to me.
I have one year experience with Ruby on Rails framework, really I love it other than any backend framework.
I have an offer from good company to work with PHP (Drupal)/Ruby (Rails) (the twice) are these mix is good or not? also from career plan perspective is good to focus on these mixing technologies or not ? 
note: I hate PHP

data.message:
Know what role you're going to take. A RoR developer or PHP developer ? If RoR then go ahead. If PHP then stay away from it if you hate PHP .. Life is too short

But to be honest a developer should be able to work with whatever tools assigned to him... Well, I don't like this rule ! :D
my position it's role to use the both

Here's the best choice, being a backend engineer is the best. Never get stuck with one technologies (and do not get stuck with it emotionally too ;) ). Being a backend engineer your role is to use a mix of here and there to come out with the best solution. for example having a mix of node/php app or mongo/mysql for the same app. Being a full stack engineer will be the best ever ;) 
and as Rafael Adel said being a developer means that being able to work with whatever technology.

Working on bigger products is more important to your career than the programming language. Even if you will use PHP only on this company, you can still work with RoR in your free time as a freelancer or on open-source.
